definitions: To give up or hand over (a person, a right, or a possession) to another, especially under compulsion or demand.
To give oneself up, especially to an enemy or an authority.
To yield to a superior force or power.
To give up or abandon (a habit, a plan, etc.).
examples: The suspect surrenders to the police.
The city surrenders after a long siege.
He surrenders his claim to the property.
